dialogues.text: (laughs despite herself) I guess you could call him that, yes. (sad) It wouldn’t be the worst he’s endured. Laura’s our resident expert on Hamilton but if you really want to understand the way things work in this town and you can get him to talk to you, take Paul for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: (surprised) And?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Seemed like a bit of a quack. (rapid fire) Quack-quack-quackeroni.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Now that’s unkind. And incorrect.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: He’s sure got a bug up his ass about Moses Randolph. Hard to believe they’re brothers. a look at him, shocked by this statement.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: I have no idea how you came by that information but I’1l venture it wasn’t from Paul. It’s a knowledge I’ve never even shared with my own staff. (beat, deciding...) Paul Randolph understands the way a city works like very few do...the living machinery of it. He’s as brilliant and visionary as his brother. But still a true idealist.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: So what...he’s an organizer? Against his own brother?  Pink Revisions 96.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Lord no...No. He’s one of the most gifted engineers of his generation. But he’s had a very rough road for a while now...hanging around the fringes for years picking up scraps on jobs he should have led. Such a waste. But he has proposed a master plan for the redesign of the State’s electrical grid that is a work of genius and everybody knows it. They have to approve it and they’1l have to give him the appointment to lead it... it’ll make every agency that touches it look good and so even his brother won't be able to deny him.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Why would he deny him?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Because it was Moses Randolph who destroyed him.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: What makes a person destroy their own brother?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: They came from a very well-to-do family...raised for civic duty, literally. They were like the twin princes of the reform movement. But they broke horribly. Who knows why. I’ve always assumed it was because Moses went inside and started working for the Governor.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Not exactly an epic betrayal.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Oh, the political is personal in that family. Paul is very opinionated as you saw and if you disagree with Moses Randolph you become an enemy of the state. He takes more sadistic joy in hurting people than any man I’ve ever seen. He ruined Paul, purposefully and relentlessly. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 99 Pink Revisions 97.

dialogues.speaker: GABBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Destroyed his career. And he’s more dangerous than ever now.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Why now?

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: Because the Board of Estimate votes on both his Arterial Highway and Slum Clearance plans this week! Verranzano, Long Island Expressway, Title 1 and everything else. (shakes her head) People have no idea what’s about to happen here. If he puts this through, the fate of the City’s written. Millions of people ground under or caught in this hell forever...or at least until cars can fly. All because one man is blind to the ways the world has changed and contemptuous of any vision but his own. He thinks this is the final stroke of his masterpiece so he’s bullying everyone into submission. Pulling out his files. (beat) It’s detestable, it sickens the soul...but I dream that someone will pull out a file on him. And we've been working on it, believe me but we’re almost out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel absorbs all of this. HORNS and ANGRY VOICES RISE AROUND THEM as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE CURB: GABBY’S CAR pulls up to where Laura and another staff member stand waiting. Gabby jumps out and Laura grabs her hand and, leaving Lionel behind, we rush with them across and through the center of the Arch, revealing REFORMER #2 speaking to the crowd of a large protest. Hundreds have gathered: placards, real citizens every stripe out in force, energized and angry.

dialogues.speaker: REFORMER
dialogues.text: Let’s not mince words because the moment we are living in calls for naming things as they are! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 Pink Revisions 98.

dialogues.speaker: REFORMER
dialogues.text: This is not a program of slum removal, it is a program of Negro removal! The crowd takes up a chant: ‘Relocate Randolph!’ CLOSE ON: Lionel sliding into a spot at the back of the crowd. He scans the scene... LIONEL POV: Laura handing Gabby notes as she gets ready; some men around the edges who seem to be photographing th crowd; and Paul: standing back in the fringes, clapping a Gabby steps up to the podium to cheers

dialogues.speaker: GABBY
dialogues.text: What is a City? Is it a place where people slave for the Lords of steel and concrete? A corral for the Druids of Finance to fleece mankind in? NO! the City is its people, it is its Communities! The City is built to serve US! Lionel’s gaze shifts past her to: THE BIG BLACK BA-1 CAR: sliding innocuously in to park on the curb beyond the trees. GABBY (cont'd) (CONT'D) Who's going to stand up for the City?! (crowd roars “We Are!") Who's going to remind the politicians and the power brokers and the profiteers that the City belongs to the PEOPLE who live in it?! The CROWD ROARS...and we CUT TO: INT. MOSES’S BLACK CAR/EXT. WASHINGTON SQ PARK - SAME 100 Lieberman and Moses Randolph sit in the back seat, watchi as they talk...

dialogues.speaker: LIEBERMAN
dialogues.text: ..-he’s not here today, he’s not that brave...but he still might not go along with the vote. Says his constituency is up in arms...

dialogues.speaker: RANDOLPH
dialogues.text: We made him Borough President and put him on the Board of Estimate. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 102 Pink Revisions 99.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOLPH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're his constituency. Don't tell me he won't go along... He pulls a file out of the valise the Aide gave him and hands it over to Lieberman, casually as a man hands over Kleenex. RANDOLPH (cont'd) (CONT'D) Show him that the day before the vote. He’ll go along. He’s a louse. Sound of the CROWD, ROARING... RANDOLPH (cont'd) (CONT'D) (smiling at it) I’ve never seen so much horseshit in my life. The he starts to really laugh... RANDOLPH POV: from inside the car we can see that the cro has hoisted an effigy of a man with a sign saying “Moses Randolph” hung on its neck and they are setting it to flame. Randolph’s laugh grows bigger, authentically amused. EXT. WASHINGTON SQUARE PARK/MOSES’S BLACK CAR- CONTINUOUB Outside the car we can hear his muffled laughter as... Paul watches the car, rage on his face...Lionel watches Paul with mounting concern over the VIOLENT ANGER in Paul... THE EFFIGY OF RANDOLPH, now fully on FIRE, is waved above the cheering crowd...and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The protest is over and Paul is shambling away, pulling u his thin coat against the cold. Lionel hustles up from behind to catch up with him. Paul perceives him and, after a moment of fear, realizes who it is... (as before Paul’s speech is like a fire-hose a manic blitz of information)

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The reporter who never reports...  Pink Revisions 100.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: I’m still putting the pieces together.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: You need me to write it for you? Jeez you’re no Jacob Riis are you? Okay here’s your next headline: “New Expressway Will be the World's Biggest Parking Lot.”

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Because cars are a cancer and roads make them metastasize not shrink. We need trains but he’s killing the trains.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Always with the ‘why?’ Because he doesn’t control the revenue from trains, he controls the tolls on bridges and roads. Borough Authority. You know what an Authority is? Neither did anybody else. He invented it. A 4th branch of govt ...a shadow branch...with independent revenue that is the only reliable financing for public works, all controlled by him meaning he controls everything and yet nobody ever voted for him and they can’t vote him out.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: That’s just the City, how’s he get it around the Legislature?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (without a pause) Section 7-paragraphs 3 and 5- Clauses A to F: powers governing sale of bonds, toll rates, are part of the contract with holders of the bonds-That's the Authority- that's him. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pink Revisions 101.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He slipped that amendment into the state bill himself, wrote it HIMSELF, and he writes a piece of legislation or a contract like the goddam Swiss build a watch. He is a master. The people, the people's courts, the people's elected reps can't stop him. How could they? They don’t even understand how he’s done what he’s done. (stops and turns) He is the most powerful person in the history of this City. He isa autocratic Caesar. And nobody realizes it. They’re all walking around calm as Hindu cows, thinking they live in a Democracy so what could go wrong?. Now are you going to write it or what?!

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Where's it illegal? How does he make everyone line up? Bribes?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Bribes are for amateurs and fringe players. Patronage is the art of the powerful. Plus every government secretary is on his payroll and he gets carbons of the memos of anyone who opposes him. He puts his snoops on them, finds dirt or makes it up and then breaks out the files when he needs them. (turning on Lionel, angry) Now are you going to write it or

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: If you've got the goods why don’t you take him down?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (snapping) ‘Cause it can’t be me!

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Cause you’re his brother? This is the first thing that stops Paul’s torrent and mak him look stricken and vulnerable...  Pink Revisions 102.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I’ve still got dreams. That’s why. Dreams I’m this close to realizing. My contribution to society...my legacy! I won’t risk it. (whispering - paranoid) Okay here, look at Belmont Developers and Inwood Residential.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (sharp-resentful) Christ, I’m giving you the goods! A map to the scoop of the decade...Do your own damn job! Do the job! I got enough problems... And with that he’s leaving...waving off Lionel and muttering to himself...and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SAME DAY
dialogues.text: A CLERK leads Lionel to an open table where he puts down big metal file of records...Lionel moves to slide it towa a chair but the Clerk stops him.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Oh sorry, I‘ll need your name and social security number.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: I’m not checking it out, I’m gonna look at it right here...

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Sure, yeah...but, um...see... parties wishing to review incorporation materials of city contractors have to register with Construction Commissioner's office.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: That can’t be legal. Eagle! Beagle! Bagel!

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Not really a law, more of a rule, Mr.... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 105 Pink Revisions 103.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: Lionel’s license) Ess. Rog.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Ass-dog, Bailey!

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Yeah, so...This isn’t a reading room but we do insist on quiet nonetheless. And we’1ll be closing in 15 minutes. So maybe... He starts to pull the file away but Lionel stops him and flips the book and moves to sign and sees... CLOSE ON: the last name on the register is ‘Frank Minna’, with Frank’s signature. He’s standing on Frank’s trail...and he signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel sits at the table with the documents, poring throu them. CLOSE ON: documents of incorporation for “Belmont Developers”, “Inwood Residential Services”...applications for City contracts... Details captured as Lionel writes in his notebook: the companies were incorporated in 1952; prior contracts with city - NONE; references of note - NONE; Then he sees: Officers: WILLIAM LIEBERMAN, GEORGE SPAULDING, TOM BROOKS. Both companies...SAME NAMES, SAME

dialogues.speaker: PARTNERS
dialogues.text: He double checks it in disbelief:

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: (getting worked up)

dialogues.speaker: IF
dialogues.text: He tries to muffle it but he looks up and the CLERK is standing over him and looking at his watch and off his so smile we CUT TO:

dialogues.text: Lionel on the phone with Tony...  106 107 108 Pink Revisions 104.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Tony. Stick around tonight, will ya? I’m on my way back, I got something interesting I just gotta check out one thing on the way... what?...company called Inwood but it won’t mean nothing until I talk to you...just wait for me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The early evening dark of winter. LIONEL hustles to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny single room with a single reception desk. Absurdly spare. A LONE SECRETARY who looks up from a book.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: You have the applications for relocation?

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Yeah, just there! She points at a huge stack on the counter to his left.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: And we can return those here? It’ll be my wife most likely. She points again at an even bigger pile...two or three boxes of completed forms against a wall. She smiles and w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel watches as... THE SECRETARY opens the door, braces it open, hauls out a box, closes the door and locks it. She then hefts the box, walks over to a bunch of trash ca and lifts the metal lid and tips the box in. She dusts he hands and walks off for the night. LIONEL HUSTLES ACROSS THE STREET, straight to the cans. He opens the lid and the clang of it echoes in the dark. reaches in and pulls up...a handful of the forms.  Pink Revisions 105. He seizes a few to hold up into the light and examine whe the SCRAPE OF A SHOE IN GRAVEL makes him turn into... The FLASH of movement of an ARM....THONK. LIONEL’s POV: the world spins upward as he goes down and we can hear him groan...backlit by the street lamp, figur in a hat leans down...LOU bending over him, the leather s still in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: People’s trash remains private property until its collected. Anybody ever tell you that? Behind the smaller man...THE GIANT STEPS INTO VIEW, loomi almost out of frame... LOU (cont'd) (CONT'D) I think we’ve seen each other before, ain’t we? (to the Giant) Ain't we? The GIANT NODS. Sounds: a match. Flames whoosh OS, lighti LOU’s face, as the Giant burns the evidence. LOU (cont'd) (CONT'D) Keep sticking your nose in people’s trash and we'll be seeing each other again. They step out of frame and the streetlight FLARES in our eyes and we hear their footsteps start away when...

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Giant Faggot Munchkin Meat! The footsteps stop and start back... LIONEL (0.S.) (cont'd) (CONT'D) Goddam it... LOU leans in again...closer

dialogues.speaker: LOU
dialogues.text: Jeez, I was told to go easy and I did. But now you made me go and do this. HIS FOOT rises up and comes down into our face with a nas CRACKING THUD. BLACK. And then we FADE UP INTO:  Pink Revisions 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIONEL is holding an ice bag against the back of his head and has a bruise starting to color under one eye. He’s going over it all with TONY...CONEY and DANNY listen and try to follow.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: ..-I’m telling you, they make Tammany look like AA ball...it’s the biggest gravy train of the century...and it’s pulling out in two days!

dialogues.speaker: CONEY
dialogues.text: We coulda used youse in Korea, Lionel...

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CONEY
dialogues.text: Cause ya talk Chinese better’n half the chinks in the city...

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Chinky, Chunky Chowder! Go to hell, Coney. Lunk-a-loaf, Beef Brain! Coney laughs and looks at Tony like “Am I right?” But Ton is not paying attention to Lionel’s tics for once...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Go get him an aspirin, Gil... (to Lionel) Coney folds a straight if the cards aren’t all the same color. Don’t pay no attention to him. Look, people cut deals with the pols for contracts, what else is new? Kicking up the chain, it’s the nature of things...

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Not people...they’re making deals with themselves! They say it’s a slum or in the route of a road, sell it to themselves for nothing to redevelop it, give themselves the contract to handle the relocations, never do any of it and leave the City holding the bag! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pink Revisions 107.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s not kickbacks, it’s Grand Larceny... Land a Farce on me! Farce me, Bailey! He’s really wound up, twitching bad.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Calm down... (to Danny) You got any weed? Give ‘ima smoke. Lionel resists... TONY (cont'd) (CONT'D) Have a smoke, Freak--. Lionel, have a smoke, you need to calm down. Danny pulls a joint out and starts it up hands it to Lion who goes ahead and takes a deep pull. TONY (cont'd) (CONT'D) Okay...so it’s big stuff. How was Frank into it?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Every one of the officers of the Borough Authority is gonna make millions. But none of it ties to him.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: To Frank?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: To Randolph!

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (incredulous) The Parks Commissioner?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: It’s all about him. The girl has the line on the scam, she’s been digging into those companies for Horowitz. I think she found something that ties Randolph right to it. Frank was on her and figured it out. When he made his play to Randolph’s men he said he had a signature. I’m telling you, it’s Randolph. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 Pink Revisions

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We lost em on the Borough Bridge, for chrissake -- Tribe of Rough RIDERS. FUCK. ME. BAILEY! Dammit, they had a pass for the Borough Authority Bridge, T, they waved em through... Worked up and exhausted, he sucks hard on the joint. is listening very attentively to him...

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Alright...alright, calm down. Fuckin’ Lionel...I think you’re on the sniff. I do. But what’s the angle on the guy at the club? Her father. What was Frank doing talking to him?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: I got no idea...part makes no sense to me. But he knows something. Tony nods.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Go home. Let me do some calling around. Lionel looks at him...confused...getting high...

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Who you gonna call?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Just trust me and let me run with it. I’m on your side. 108. Tony Lionel doesn’t know what that means but he’s too stoned n to sort it. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: C’mon. I’1l give ya a ride. INT. LIONEL’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Lionel enters, stoned and sore. 110 TIGHT ON: Minna’s hat, as he hangs it on the wall next to his own  Pink Revisions 109. He flops on the bed and the cat appears and he strokes it He has just closed his eyes when the RINGING PHONE JOLTS HIM LIKE A SHOCK. He answers it...

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Yeah... BILLY’S VOICE I know who you are. Lionel says nothing... BILLY'S VOICE (cont’d) (CONT'D) You’re one of Minna’s boys...

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Who’s Minna? Who is this? BILLY’S VOICE Don’t bullshit me, motherfucker. You gave your card to the man with the horn. You know who this is now?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. So what? BILLY’S VOICE Where’s the envelope?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. (beat) What’s in it? BILLY’S VOICE Hold on... Sounds of Billy doing something.... BILLY'S VOICE (cont'd) (CONT'D) We can’t talk about it like this. It ain’t safe. Meet me up at the club. Park up the block and come in the back, I’1l1 let you in there. CLICK. Lionel looks at the phone a beat. Then he sits up and goes to a desk drawer and opens it and pulls out MINNA’s AUTOMATIC PISTOL. He drops the mag out and checks it and shoves it back in and on the SNAP we...CUT TO:  111 112 Pink Revisions 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel pauses at the opening of the alley, checks around him when...BANG!...a muffled report snaps his head around Was that a shot? Hard to tell where it came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel walks cautiously down the alley, past trash cans where Billy yelled at him, reaching the back door of the club. He prods the door open slowly with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: (calls quietly) Billy? SOUNDS OF VOICES CURSING SOFTLY, FEET MOVING. He cautious enters the back door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over Lionel’s shoulder as he works his way into the club the back hall and emerges into the back of the stage revealing...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIGURE OF BILLY SITTING IN A CHAIR ON THE BANDSTAND,
dialogues.text: the light from the street silhouetting him

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Billy...? You hear that? LIONEL STOPS COLD...BILLY is holding a gun down by his si with SMOKE STILL CURLING FROM THE BARREL. He seems to be staring forward toward the front where the door is creaki open as though someone has left fast...but something is odd... And then as Lionel comes around him he can see... BILLY ROSE IS DEAD IN THE CHAIR...blood running down his white shirt from a gunshot wound through the chest and a belt tied around his chest to hold himself up. A suicide? LIONEL (cont'd) (CONT'D) Oh no...BillyBillyBeBopRose...oh shit... Then he stops cold, hairs on his neck rising...THE GUN IS HANGING IN BILLY'S USELESS RIGHT HAND. LIONEL RIPS HIS GUN OUT, SPINS TOWARD THE FRONT. SOUND OF A CAR STARTING ON THE STREET. He hustles to the front cubicle and bursts out onto...  Pink Revisions 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIONEL BURSTS ONTO THE STREET in time to see...a BLACK CA turning the corner, smooth and quiet...spooky...and gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop cars...patrolmen guarding the door. A DETECTIVE is interviewing Lionel...not your average 3rd Class Dick...this guy has rank...

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: (spinning it already) So he told you to come and then bumped himself so you could find him before staff came in probably.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: (exasperated) I already told you, I didn’t just find him...I heard it happen. He didn’t shoot himself...SHOOT MY SHIT!... Sorry...I‘m tired... Somebody shot him and set it up to look like he punched out. I heard ‘em leave.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Powder burn on his shirt. Point blank. Neighbors telling us he had money problems...Seems pretty straightforward, friend.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: The gun’s in his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: He’s got a dead right arm, ace. War wound. He can’t lift a Zippo with it let alone a .38. You wanna show me how he shot himself in the heart with his left hand and then handed it off to his right before he said goodnight?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: No sign of struggle...  115 Pink Revisions 112.

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Bullshit, there’s bruises coming up on his neck and little scratches from where he tried to claw someone off him.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Guy’s darker than ink...you gonna tell me you can spot a bruise on a neck like that? (grinning) He propped himself up with his own belt...dignified, I’1l give him that. THE BODY IS BEING BROUGHT OUT ON A STRETCHER. Lionel glances at the COP, something not right...

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: They usually put Division dicks on dawn patrol in Harlem?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Oh, we go wherever we’re needed. Must be some brass that love jazz, wanted him to get due respect... He winks as over his shoulder LIONEL sees... LAURA RUNNING DOWN THE SIDEWALK. HE SPRINTS TOWARD HER TO STOP HER...

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Oh no...Oh NOOOOO! She pushes past him to Billy’s body, distraught. WIDE: the sad tableau of her bent over BILLY’S BODY with Lionel hanging behind...and music floats in as we CUT TO: INT. LAURA’S HALLWAY / APARTMENT DOOR - NIGHT 115 He escorts her up the stairs of the tenement apartment to her door. She inserts the key but stops with her hand on it. Her head falls and she starts weeping. He reaches dow gently and pulls her hand off the key, turns it himself a opens the door. She stands in the doorway with tears falling silently dow her face.  Pink Revisions 113.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: I can’t think of the last time I saw him smile...But...why would he do that...to himself...? Her voice breaks...he lifts her face up...

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: He didn’t. Someone wanted it to look that way. She shakes her head...

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Man was angry as long as I can remember. But nobody hated him like that...nobody. He reflexively touches her shoulder three times in a row. She accepts it...too upset to care. LAURA (cont'd) (CONT'D) Who would do such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
dialogues.text: Same people did it to a friend of mine. She looks up, confused...but too sad to try to understand LIONEL (cont'd) (CONT'D) You got somebody you can call? She shakes her head and weeps... LIONEL (cont'd) (CONT'D) You’re all alone?

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: You got no idea... She weeps. He kisses her forehead but pulls back, awkward LAURA (cont'd) (CONT'D) Could you...stay with me a while?

dialogues.speaker: LIONEL
